name: places/ChIJgbFID5VZwokRgHT1cAg3jB0
adrFormatAddress: 118 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: We ordered the 口水鸡 (steamed chicken with chili oil), spicy beef brisket rice noodle and tomato beef rice noodle. All three dishes were delicious and seasoned well (definitely not bland like a previous review). Will definitely be back to try the chicken broth rice noodle!

text.text: We ordered the 口水鸡 (steamed chicken with chili oil), spicy beef brisket rice noodle and tomato beef rice noodle. All three dishes were delicious and seasoned well (definitely not bland like a previous review). Will definitely be back to try the chicken broth rice noodle!

originalText.text:
Okay, I arrived late. Meeting friends they ordered noodles and appetizers and they told me that it was like a show when you receive your noodles. They add in and mix all the ingredients together.

I can tell you that the service here is impeccable! Friendly, fast and kind. The food tastes delicious! Incredible really. Fresh, healthy and so so good.

I will be back soon to get the full experience! You should too.

originalText.text:
If you like bland food, this is your spot! We are east village locals and have tried many restaurants in the area. We were hungry and excited for the noodle soups and got the chicken and mushroom soups to our huge disappointment. The soups were very underwhelming and nearly flavorless. The fried chicken also had a weird powdery flavor. The chicken in my soup also had a tough/almost rubbery feel and still looked a bit undercooked.

Not sure if they had an off night or this is their regular style, but there are too many great and amazing restaurants in the neighborhood and this one unfortunately did not have that quality. We love new spots, but can honestly say we will not be trying this restaurant again. :-(

originalText.text:
Food was eh... Service was decent.

Chicken Broth Ramen: Although the soup was pretty OK, the ramen noodles were terrible. It tasted uncooked, mushy and doughy. I’d get the rice noodles instead.

Popcorn Chicken: Flavorless, Hard and Too chewy. Ketchup was not the sauce we were expecting to come with this. Would have been better if it was sweet and sour sauce.

originalText.text: The service is good. The food is good. They have two options for you to choose, either rice noodle or ramen. The rice noodle is so good, smooth and taste a bit like angel hair pasta, but softer. My favorite is the hot appetizer, big amount and taste so good. Overall the flavor is light. It’s a good place if you wanna grab a quick lunch or dinner here.
